meanings.definition: To show or display something for others to see.
meanings.sent1: The artist exhibited her paintings at the gallery.
meanings.sent2: The museum exhibited ancient artifacts from Egypt.
meanings.sent3: The cat exhibited its hunting skills by catching a toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: The storm exhibited its power by knocking down trees.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks display exhibited a dazzling array of colors.

meanings.definition: To present or put on display.
meanings.sent1: The students exhibited their science projects at the fair.
meanings.sent2: The fashion designer exhibited her latest collection on the runway.
meanings.sent3: The clown exhibited his silly antics to make the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: The sun exhibited its warmth on a cold winter day.
meanings.sent5: The chef's culinary skills were exhibited in the delicious meal.

meanings.definition: To demonstrate a particular quality or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The athlete exhibited great sportsmanship after the game.
meanings.sent2: The speaker exhibited confidence during the presentation.
meanings.sent3: The toddler exhibited curiosity by exploring every corner of the room.
meanings.sent4: The teacher exhibited patience while explaining a difficult concept.
meanings.sent5: The dog exhibited loyalty by staying by its owner's side.
